name: ObHttpApiInterceptorConfig
usage: Should by injected, typically in the AppModule, to customize the values of its properties in order to provide alternate default values for the HttpApiInterceptor.

variables.name: api.url
variables.text: Matching URLs will be treated as API calls and thus affected by this interceptor.

variables.name: api.spinner
variables.text: Defines if a spinner should be activated whenever an API call starts.

variables.name: api.notification.active
variables.text: Defines if a notification should be displayed in case of API error response.

variables.name: timeout
variables.text: The timeout to wait before considering an API call as failed. A notification will be issued to warn the user about request timeout, but the request itself won't be cancelled.

variables.name: requestIntercepted
variables.text: This observable emits events before the request is sent to the server and can be used to tweak the behavior of the interceptor.

variables.name: sessionExpired
variables.text: This observable emits when the server respond with a 401 error, which is typically the case with an expired EIAM session.

methods.name: deactivateSpinnerOnNextAPICalls
methods.text: No spinner will be activated on the next number API calls.

methods.name: deactivateNotificationOnNextAPICalls
methods.text: No notification will be activated on the next number API calls.

methods.name: deactivateOnNextAPICalls
methods.text: No spinner nor notification will be activated on the next number API calls.
